commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace create
commands.syntax:
az monitor log-analytics workspace create --name
                                          --resource-group
                                          [--capacity-reservation-level {100, 1000, 10000, 200, 2000, 25000, 300, 400, 500, 5000, 50000}]
                                          [--identity-type {None, SystemAssigned, UserAssigned}]
                                          [--ingestion-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                          [--location]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--query-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                          [--quota]
                                          [--retention-time]
                                          [--sku {CapacityReservation, Free, LACluster, PerGB2018, PerNode, Premium, Standalone, Standard}]
                                          [--tags]
                                          [--user-assigned]
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace create -g MyResourceGroup -n MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace delete
commands.syntax:
az monitor log-analytics workspace delete [--force {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--ids]
                                          [--name]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--resource-group]
                                          [--subscription]
                                          [--yes]
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace delete --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace
az monitor log-analytics workspace delete --force --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace get-schema
commands.summary: Get the schema for a given workspace.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace get-schema --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace get-shared-keys
commands.summary: Get the shared keys for a workspace.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace get-shared-keys --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list
commands.summary: Get a list of workspaces under a resource group or a subscription.

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-available-service-tier
commands.summary: List the available service tiers for the workspace.

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-deleted-workspaces
commands.summary: Get a list of deleted workspaces that can be recovered in a subscription or a resource group.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-deleted-workspaces --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-link-target
commands.summary: List a list of workspaces which the current user has administrator privileges and are not associated with an Azure Subscription.

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-management-groups
commands.summary: Get a list of management groups connected to a workspace.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-management-groups --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-usages
commands.summary: Get a list of usage metrics for a workspace.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace list-usages --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace recover
commands.summary: Recover a workspace in a soft-delete state within 14 days.
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace recover --resource-group MyResourceGroup -n MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace show
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace show --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace update
commands.syntax:
az monitor log-analytics workspace update [--add]
                                          [--capacity-reservation-level {100, 1000, 10000, 200, 2000, 25000, 300, 400, 500, 5000, 50000}]
                                          [--data-collection-rule]
                                          [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--identity-type {None, SystemAssigned, UserAssigned}]
                                          [--ids]
                                          [--ingestion-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                          [--name]
                                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                          [--query-access {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                          [--quota]
                                          [--remove]
                                          [--resource-group]
                                          [--retention-time]
                                          [--set]
                                          [--sku {CapacityReservation, Free, LACluster, PerGB2018, PerNode, Premium, Standalone, Standard}]
                                          [--subscription]
                                          [--tags]
                                          [--user-assigned]
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace update --resource-group myresourcegroup --retention-time 30 --workspace-name myworkspace

az monitor log-analytics workspace update --resource-group myresourcegroup --workspace-name myworkspace --data-collection-rule "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.Insights/dataCollectionRules/{dcrName}".

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
